sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination
message_1:
Determine the values of x, y, and z that satisfy the following system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination method:

$$
\begin{aligned}
2x+y+z&=5 \\
x-3y+2z&=0 \\
3x-y-2z&=-2
\end{aligned}
$$
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination, we will first write the augmented matrix of the system:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
2 & 1 & 1 & 5 \\
1 & -3 & 2 & 0 \\
3 & -1 & -2 & -2
\end{array}\right]
$$

Next, we will perform row operations to transform the matrix into its row-echelon form.

Step 1: Swap Row 1 and Row 2 to get a 1 in the top-left corner:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & -3 & 2 & 0 \\
2 & 1 & 1 & 5 \\
3 & -1 & -2 & -2
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 2: Replace Row 2 with Row 2 - 2 * Row 1 and Row 3 with Row 3 - 3 * Row 1:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & -3 & 2 & 0 \\
0 & 7 & -3 & 5 \\
0 & 8 & -8 & -2
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 3: Divide Row 2 by 7 to get a 1 in the second row, second column:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & -3 & 2 & 0 \\
0 & 1 & -\frac{3}{7} & \frac{5}{7} \\
0 & 8 & -8 & -2
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 4: Replace Row 1 with Row 1 + 3 * Row 2 and Row 3 with Row 3 - 8 * Row 2:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 0 & -\frac{1}{7} & \frac{15}{7} \\
0 & 1 & -\frac{3}{7} & \frac{5}{7} \\
0 & 0 & 8 & 6
\end{array}\right]
$$

Step 5: Divide Row 3 by 8 to get a 1 in the third row, third column:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 0 & -\frac{1}{7} & \frac{15}{7} \\
0 & 1 & -\frac{3}{7} & \frac{5}{7} \\
0 & 0 & 1 & \frac{3}{4}
\end{array}\right]
$$

Now, we have the row-echelon form of the matrix. We can use back-substitution to find the values of x, y, and z.

From the third row, we have:

$$
z = \frac{3}{4}
$$

From the second row, we have:

$$
y - \frac{3}{7}z = \frac{5}{7} \Rightarrow y = \frac{5}{7} + \frac{3}{7}z = \frac{5}{7} + \frac{3}{7} \cdot \frac{3}{4} = 1
$$

From the first row, we have:

$$
x - \frac{1}{7}z = \frac{15}{7} \Rightarrow x = \frac{15}{7} + \frac{1}{7}z = \frac{15}{7} + \frac{1}{7} \cdot \frac{3}{4} = 2
$$

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

$$
x = 2, y = 1, z = \frac{3}{4}
$$
